title: Trump touts bill that could make voting harder for married women
shortDescription: Here's how the voting ID law could make it harder for married women to register to vote and cast ballots if passed.

title: White House supports Lutnick amid Epstein scandal
shortDescription: Secretary of Commerce Howard Lutnick distanced himself from Jeffrey Epstein following information that he went to Epstein's island.

title: DOJ Georgia 2020 election probe kickstarted by White House, documents say
shortDescription: The DOJ's explanation for seeking to seize 2020 election ballots in Georgia was laid bare Feb. 10, after a court forced it to release a key document.

title: White House on new Nancy Guthrie suspect images

title: Two Democrats disinvited to Governors dinner
shortDescription: President Trump breaks tradition and has excluded two Democratic governors from a White House dinner.

title: Dem governors to boycott White House dinner over disinvites
shortDescription: Eighteen Democratic governors said Donald Trump disinviting two of their colleagues is the latest example of the White House's "chaos and division."

title: 'This is how a wave starts': Democrat wins Louisiana special election
shortDescription: On the heels of a state legislative win in Texas, Democrats saw a 37-point swing that kept a Louisiana state House seat in their ranks

title: Susan Collins confirms 2026 Maine re-election run
shortDescription: Sen. Susan Collins, a Republican from Maine, posted an unboxing video to confirm her run for re-election in 2026.

title: Trump threatens to block Detroit Windsor bridge
shortDescription: President Trump is threatening to block the Detroit Windsor Bridge until the U.S. receives full compensation, questioning Canada's ownership and trade deals.

title: ICE on hot seat as officials testify before Congress: recap

title: GOP congressman calls for FCC action over Bad Bunny's Super Bowl show

title: Trump excludes two Democrats from White House dinner with governors
shortDescription: President Trump has excluded two Democratic governors, Wes Moore of Maryland and Jared Polis of Colorado, from a White House dinner with governors.
